greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Motzkin paths of length n having k HH's, where H=(1,0).
example: T(4,1)=3 because we have HHUD, UDHH and UHHD, where U=(1,1), D=(1,-1) and H=(1,0).
xref: Column 0 yields A104545. Row sums yield the Motzkin numbers (A001006).
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 14 2005
